thread.title: General strike called Tuesday for Arab sector to protest police, support al-Aksa - Arab-Israeli Conflict
thread.title_full: General strike called Tuesday for Arab sector to protest police, support al-Aksa - Arab-Israeli Conflict - Jerusalem Post

author: ARIK BENDER \
title: General strike called Tuesday for Arab sector to protest police, support al-Aksa - Arab-Israeli Conflict
text:
The High Follow-Up Committee for Arab Citizens of Israel, an organization representing Arab citizens in Israel, called for a general strike in the Arab sector for Tuesday to protest the events of the past days and in the group's words "the danger that the Aksa Mosque in Jerusalem faces as well as the police's light finger on the trigger" when faced with suspected acts of terror.
The strike will include schools and the commercial sector and a general strike will also take place on the same day in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank.
On Wednesday all of the Arab MKs from the Joint List party plan to visit the Aksa Mosque in Jerusalem together with the members of the HFCACI. The planned visit is in contravention of a guideline released last week by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu instructing Jewish and Arab MKs not to visit the Temple Mount, a flashpoint religious site for violence in the capital that is holy to both observant Jews and Muslims.
The MKs and the HFCACI were also planning to attend a large demonstration in the Galilee town of Sakhnin set for Wednesday.
